events.name: Lithium-Ion Battery Development and Impact
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries (Li-ion) are a type of rechargeable battery known for their high specific energy, energy density, efficiency, and long cycle and calendar life. Since their market introduction in 1991, they have significantly improved in energy density and cost, impacting various sectors including consumer electronics, transportation, and grid-scale energy storage.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries (Li-ion) are a type of rechargeable battery known for their high specific energy, energy density, efficiency, and long cycle and calendar life. Since their market introduction in 1991, they have significantly improved in energy density and cost, impacting various sectors including consumer electronics, transportation, and grid-scale energy storage.

events.name: Construction and Chemistries
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries use the reversible intercalation of Li+ ions into electronically conducting solids to store energy. There are at least 12 different chemistries of Li-ion batteries, each optimized for specific applications.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries use the reversible intercalation of Li+ ions into electronically conducting solids to store energy. There are at least 12 different chemistries of Li-ion batteries, each optimized for specific applications.

events.name: rgy Optimization
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion cells can be manufactured to optimize either energy or power density, making them suitable for a wide range of applications.
events.description: Lithium-ion cells can be manufactured to optimize either energy or power density, making them suitable for a wide range of applications.

events.name: ferent Chemistries
events.wd_description: At least 12 different chemistries of Li-ion batteries exist, each offering unique benefits and trade-offs for various applications.
events.description: At least 12 different chemistries of Li-ion batteries exist, each offering unique benefits and trade-offs for various applications.

events.name: Impact on Technologies
events.wd_description: The invention and commercialization of Li-ion batteries enabled the development of portable consumer electronics, laptops, cellular phones, electric cars, and grid-scale energy storage, significantly impacting modern technology and earning a Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2019.
events.description: The invention and commercialization of Li-ion batteries enabled the development of portable consumer electronics, laptops, cellular phones, electric cars, and grid-scale energy storage, significantly impacting modern technology and earning a Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2019.

events.name: sumer Electronics
events.wd_description: Li-ion batteries enabled the widespread use of portable consumer electronics, including laptops and cellular phones.
events.description: Li-ion batteries enabled the widespread use of portable consumer electronics, including laptops and cellular phones.

events.name: nsportation
events.wd_description: Li-ion batteries play a crucial role in the electrification of transport, contributing to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from vehicles.
events.description: Li-ion batteries play a crucial role in the electrification of transport, contributing to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from vehicles.

events.name: rgy Storage
events.wd_description: Li-ion batteries are used for grid-scale energy storage as well as military and aerospace applications.
events.description: Li-ion batteries are used for grid-scale energy storage as well as military and aerospace applications.

events.name: Safety and Environmental Concerns
events.wd_description: Lithium-ion batteries can be a safety hazard if not properly engineered and manufactured due to their flammable electrolytes. Additionally, improper recycling can create toxic waste, and the extraction of lithium and other key minerals can have significant environmental impacts.
events.description: Lithium-ion batteries can be a safety hazard if not properly engineered and manufactured due to their flammable electrolytes. Additionally, improper recycling can create toxic waste, and the extraction of lithium and other key minerals can have significant environmental impacts.

events.name: ety Hazards
events.wd_description: Flammable electrolytes in Li-ion batteries can lead to explosions and fires if damaged or incorrectly charged.
events.description: Flammable electrolytes in Li-ion batteries can lead to explosions and fires if damaged or incorrectly charged.

events.name: ycling Concerns
events.wd_description: Improperly recycled Li-ion batteries can create toxic waste, especially from toxic metals, and pose a fire risk.
events.description: Improperly recycled Li-ion batteries can create toxic waste, especially from toxic metals, and pose a fire risk.

events.name: ironmental Impact
events.wd_description: The extraction of lithium is water-intensive, often in arid regions, and other minerals used in Li-ion batteries, such as cobalt, can be conflict minerals.
events.description: The extraction of lithium is water-intensive, often in arid regions, and other minerals used in Li-ion batteries, such as cobalt, can be conflict minerals.

events.name: Cathode Materials
events.wd_description: There are three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries: layered oxides, spinel oxides, and oxoanion complexes, all discovered by John Goodenough and his collaborators.
events.description: There are three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries: layered oxides, spinel oxides, and oxoanion complexes, all discovered by John Goodenough and his collaborators.

events.name: ered Oxides
events.wd_description: Layered oxides are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Layered oxides are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: nel Oxides
events.wd_description: Spinel oxides are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Spinel oxides are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: anion Complexes
events.wd_description: Oxoanion complexes are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.
events.description: Oxoanion complexes are one of the three classes of commercial cathode materials in lithium-ion batteries.

events.name: Anode Materials
events.wd_description: Negative electrode materials in lithium-ion batteries are traditionally constructed from graphite and other carbon materials, with newer silicon-based materials being increasingly used.
events.description: Negative electrode materials in lithium-ion batteries are traditionally constructed from graphite and other carbon materials, with newer silicon-based materials being increasingly used.

events.name: phite and Carbon Materials
events.wd_description: In 2016, 89% of lithium-ion batteries contained graphite, with the remainder containing amorphous carbon, lithium titanate (LTO), or silicon/tin-based materials.
events.description: In 2016, 89% of lithium-ion batteries contained graphite, with the remainder containing amorphous carbon, lithium titanate (LTO), or silicon/tin-based materials.

events.name: icon-Based Materials
events.wd_description: Silicon-based materials are being increasingly used in lithium-ion batteries, offering potential benefits over traditional carbon-based materials.
events.description: Silicon-based materials are being increasingly used in lithium-ion batteries, offering potential benefits over traditional carbon-based materials.
